data.text: Continues this week at @UNGeneva: Committee on the Elimination of Racial Discrimination, 96th session (through 30 August): https://t.co/QbasdXqF6M https://t.co/l5YSrj9bOH
What's happening this week at the UN? World Humanitarian Day, remembrance of victims of terrorism & more. List of events is here: https://t.co/kSy5Kn2Dp8 https://t.co/ir9eNbbSwv
Ahead of #YouthDay, the @UNYouthEnvoy travelled to Bangladesh this week to meet with Rohingya refugees & young people from their host community to talk about #SafeSpaces4Youth https://t.co/8XEksLopfK

We carry forward the memory of our colleagues who died 15 years ago in the 2003 Canal Hotel Bombing in Baghdad as we strive to resolve and prevent armed conflict. Aid workers and civilians are #NotaTarget. https://t.co/UGzkaMCZlu
In NYC we are helping #BeatPlasticPollution by using sustainable paper straws. @UNEnvironment has more tips on how to take action for #ClearSeas here: https://t.co/r9i5lRy6FM https://t.co/VuVAMCQoAC
Starting 1 September, @mbachelet of Chile will become the new @UNHumanRights chief. Find out more about her new role & the office: https://t.co/XZ15EJGFgi #standup4humanrights https://t.co/zV7MDqrzaB
As the end of 4-year term of @UNHumanRights chief Zeid approaches, @antonioguterres thanks him for his leadership, passion, courage & skill. https://t.co/wxa1jMF9MC https://t.co/uF5ZPslVl8
Forests sustain us with air 💨 water 💧 & food 🍓. The #GlobalGoals aim to protect them, reverse land degradation & halt biodiversity loss. Learn more: https://t.co/MX5SPAGmWN https://t.co/ERHGtK6GQV

On #YouthDay and every day, @UN_Women is working with young women & men to make the world more equal, sustainable and peaceful for all. https://t.co/xarfW5Y138 #SafeSpaces4Youth https://t.co/DBxSbnu7pX

Defending the vulnerable's never been more vital with "oppression making a comeback."

Listen to a preview of @UNHumanRights chief Zeid Ra'ad al-Hussein's final in-depth interview with @UN_News_Centre as he prepares to leave his key post. 

https://t.co/fV8GmFWOvi
"Let Nagasaki & Hiroshima remind us to put peace first every day" -- @antonioguterres during a visit to Japan this week https://t.co/0WZunupXU0 https://t.co/EmFjzxskG8

"Peace, economic dynamism, social justice, tolerance – all this and more, today and tomorrow, depends on tapping into the power of youth." -- @antonioguterres on #YouthDay: https://t.co/EcgYnOZhPl https://t.co/Q8XrQyP5hr

So small & yet so smart!

Join @AminaJMohammed on a tour of the sustainable tiny house on display at UNHQ in our latest @instagram story ➡️ https://t.co/UH4OQC7zhU https://t.co/gfOhvQ3TbP

Sunday's #YouthDay focuses on the need for #SafeSpaces4Youth that are readily available & accessible - helping young people feel valued & giving them room to develop their skills https://t.co/V6jAmu7BY6 https://t.co/PwHLxFCjuw

"All human beings are born free & equal in dignity and rights."

Hear @UNHumanRights chief Zeid speak with last surviving Nuremberg prosecutor @BenFerencz about the importance of the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. https://t.co/lf3uwcLy79?

"Out of the horror of the atomic bomb, we can reach a deeper understanding of our irreducible bonds of responsibility to each other." -- @antonioguterres, 73 years after the atomic bombing of Hiroshima and Nagasaki https://t.co/0WZunupXU0 https://t.co/RtR0tlrKYh
The #PreventGenocide Convention was adopted 70 years ago. 45 countries have yet to join. See if your country is one of them: https://t.co/7AHmLrCYhj https://t.co/f35JSmqsVM

"I am delighted that the General Assembly has confirmed the appointment of Ms. Michelle Bachelet as the new High Commissioner for @UNHumanRights" -- @antonioguterres https://t.co/wxa1jMF9MC https://t.co/XOC4RscJiN
See how @UN_Women supports indigenous women around the world as they strive for their rights & equality: https://t.co/tkG7KQNmUl #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/VerjTYmCQI
UN Peacekeepers serve at great personal risk & under harsh conditions to help others. We thank them for their service & sacrifice. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ #ServingForPeace https://t.co/akjZVqZdP1

.@UNHumanRights Chief Zeid says he didn't discriminate against any country; felt strong pressure from victims of gross human rights violations & civil society. 

🎧 to more in this audio preview of his forthcoming interview (in Arabic). https://t.co/JsBaYA6wWy
"Let us all commit to making Nagasaki the last place on earth to suffer nuclear devastation." -- @antonioguterres during his visit to Japan this week https://t.co/0WZunupXU0 https://t.co/y8e8lOfJTV

A warm welcome to the incoming @UNHumanRights chief @mbachelet!
https://t.co/icN0EGhEpw https://t.co/g5rS5UHtxv

Refugees need your help now more than ever. Here are 8 practical ways to stand #WithRefugees ⬇️ https://t.co/cAZ0NGrDuD via @Refugees 

 https://t.co/pYACoGdETq

Michelle Bachelet brings unique experience to the UN & to all of us, and is strongly committed to keeping human rights at the forefront of the work of the UN. -- @antonioguterres on appointment of @mbachelet as new @UNHumanRights chief. https://t.co/wxa1jMnyo2 https://t.co/dQ0OefqElZ

🌲🌳 Forests cover 30% of the Earth’s surface and provide food security & shelter. They are also 🔑 to tackling climate change. Find out how the #GlobalGoals aim to protect them: https://t.co/MX5SPAoM5f https://t.co/IXM8G5njgv

At least 51 trillion microplastic particles are already in our oceans. @UNEnvironment shares 5 plastic alternatives that will help you #BeatPlasticPollution & take action for #CleanSeas 👇 https://t.co/kkuTUc2N9y

#WeAreIndigenous: See how the UN family celebrated Thursday's #IndigenousDay in this @twitter moment ⬇️

https://t.co/4Cjnb2WC11

Thursday is #IndigenousDay. Indigenous peoples have the right to freely pursue their economic, social and cultural development: https://t.co/6zly9fQb8s #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/bnwJtj7UTz

#TBT to June 2017 when a whale, a salmon & a seahorse made from trash greeted #SaveOurOcean conference participants at UNHQ.

There are 185 million indigenous women in the world. They are food
producers, guardians of native seeds and custodians of traditional knowledge. https://t.co/L3kx7DP8xy #IndigenousDay https://t.co/ffgSpyJbN1
10-year-old old Amira from Abyei saved 4-year-old Hamdan's life thanks to @UNMAS mine risk education. Read their story: https://t.co/OxHqKQanP6 https://t.co/pLQwAWGnw0

"Let us ensure that indigenous peoples enjoy recognition for their contributions and the opportunity to thrive and prosper in peace on a healthy planet." --@antonioguterres on Thursday's #IndigenousDay https://t.co/6zly9fQb8s  #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/2k4rEuEqgE

"No more Hiroshimas, no more Nagasakis. We must make sure nuclear weapons are never used again." -- @antonioguterres during his visit to Nagasaki, Japan. https://t.co/75KmRBY4Pn https://t.co/TvjyHBEFRf

Indigenous languages matter for peace, reconciliation & #GlobalGoals. 

Find out more from @UNESCO: https://t.co/EiNtBuuaOV #WeAreIndigenous https://t.co/s2qpatNyO6

The Sun ☀️

#TourTuesday: Sculpture at UNHQ depicts St. George slaying dragon, created from fragments of Soviet & US nuclear missiles.

This week marks 73 years since the nuclear bombings of Hiroshima & Nagasaki. https://t.co/LEvAezNkTd

In 2017, @WFP reached 5M pregnant & breastfeeding women and 5.9M children between 6 months and 2 yrs with malnutrition treatment and prevention programmes.

Mothers — and fathers — across the 🌍 share their experiences. 👇

https://t.co/sOWRm12e2n

"I reiterate my firm commitment to working with the Hibakusha, citizens of Hiroshima & all peoples of the world to realise our common vision of a world free of nuclear weapons." -- @antonioguterres, 73 years after the atomic bombing of Hiroshima: https://t.co/MODiOb1WSx https://t.co/3c0mWxVwiC

but share a common purpose to protect the most vulnerable. https://t.co/lZYeCoS6BZ #ServingForPeace https://t.co/k6O38cuYZb

Every 40 seconds, someone, somewhere in the world, dies by suicide.

@WHO explains what you should know if you are worried about someone: https://t.co/Gn4ahOSnx3   #LetsTalk https://t.co/FQvsfGpW43

Depression can happen to anybody.
Depression can be treated.
